projects.title: Bits 'n Ass
projects.description: In an era in which human labour is automated and reality defined by influencers who use their sexuality to sell products, Bits 'n Ass is an experiment in response to that. Can a human take over a bot's job, and can the exploitation of the female form be used to educate the masses?

projects.title: Krampus naar Nederland
projects.description: In wake of the Netherlands' societal debate about 'Zwarte Piet' (Black Pete), we've been seeking to offer an alternative solution that's closer to the olden traditions: (re-)introducing Krampus into the Netherlands.

projects.title: JUGEND
projects.description: Militant body rock project, Rotterdam's answer to totalitarian industrial bands such as Laibach. Whilst the band has existed for many years, I've joined in in 2009.

projects.title: De Observeerders (The Observers)
projects.description:
De Observeerders (Dutch for The Observers) is a collective of professional film makers with a preference for a documentary style and approach with attention and respect for what is already existent. For what's real and beautiful.

We are fascinated by stories and footage which are found in the real world around us like it is and by people like they really are. By watching attentive, by observing and asking the right questions we try to approach the essence of a good story. We work on a diverse range of assigned films. This can be the story of a person, a company or the representation of a concept. Besides work for clients we also do our own free work projects.

Authenticity, involvement, keep asking questions and looking further makes us De Observeerders (The Observers).

A lot of our films are also available with English subtitles on YouTube.

contributors.headline: Freelance video editor voor documentaires en non-scripted content

projects.title: Event: Damn Food Waste Rotterdam 2015
projects.description:
This year's Damn Food Waste event was being held in Rotterdam. Collaborating with many other local initiatives Damn Food Waste shows that a lot of food that has been discarded is still edible and valuable.

We were there with BroodNodig to show people that old bread could be given a second chance.

projects.description: A short film about the work Katja Staartjes - the first Dutch woman to have reached the top of the Mount Everest - does as a motivational speaker on themes such as teamwork and leadership.

projects.title: BroodNodig
projects.description:
In the Netherlands, 292 million kilos of bread gets thrown away every year. BroodNodig seeks a change in behavior regarding bread wastage. The goal is to reduce the amount of bread waste. The remaining bread waste should not end up with the organic waste or on the streets. Through developing the Broodnodig 010, a digester that turns bread waste into biogas, bakers can use their discarded bread to power their ovens.

YURKO's role within BroodNodig is mainly supportive, helping out with its market research, guiding the interns' research projects and maintaining the website's blog and other communication channels.

contributors.headline: Concept designer at Studio Catinca Tilea

projects.title: Radio: Radio Aktief
projects.description:
As part of the all-volunteer radio show Wakkere Honden at RTV Rijnmond, Radio Aktief takes a closer look into Rotterdam's nightlife whilst combining the sounds from the '90s with contemporary music.

Whilst the project is still on-going, I am no longer officially participating.

projects.title: freshbook
projects.description:
Freshbook is a Linux based operating system that allows old computers to operate faster and more efficiently. However, unlike most open source systems, it's a ready-to-use one, meaning users don't have to learn programming or spend hours (if not days) modifying the system before they can use it.

YURKO supports freshbook's marketing and communication activities.

profile_positions.description: As a 'Housing Consultant' (translated in Dutch as 'Sociaal Beheerder' or 'Woonconsulent') I'm responsible for the 'social aspects' of social housing. This is mainly aimed at recognising and fixing social challenges in Woonstad Rotterdam's buildings and neighbourhoods. These challenges include stimulating neighbourhood participation, helping tenants to resolve disputes and nuisances, researching and resolving housing fraud (illegal subletting, drug trade and production, prostitution, etc.), early signalling of tenants who need (mental) healthcare and connect them to healthcare agencies, and maintain contact with various external partners such as the municipality, police, healthcare organisations, and other parties.
profile_positions.title: Housing Consultant (Sociaal Beheerder / Woonconsulent)

profile_positions.description: For several months I took over the project lead for Woonstad Rotterdam's efforts at foundation repair in Kralingen, Rotterdam. My primary focus was on the tenants interests and perspectives rather than the technical aspects, which fall under the responsibility of the Project Manager.
profile_positions.title: Interim Project Lead

profile_positions.description: Housing cooperative Woonstad Rotterdam seeks to provide affordable housing for those living in Rotterdam with low or midrange incomes. Besides answering direct client questions (be it face-to-face, on the phone, by email, or social media) I'm also responsible for creating and implementing the monthly exams to test the team's substantive knowledge, collaborate with the various other departments of Woonstad Rotterdam to ensure its online knowledge database is up to date, and function as an intermediary between the various technical departments and contractors to facilitate the hundreds of repair requests Woonstad Rotterdam receives on a daily basis.
profile_positions.title: Customer Service Representative

profile_positions.description: Seeking to further develop my work experience in the fields of marketing and communication I've started doing an internship at Woonstad Rotterdam's Strategy & Communications department.
profile_positions.title: Marketing & Communications Intern

profile_positions.description: I work as a freelancer under the name YURKO. Activities include research, translation, editing, transcription, film, music, and 3D design work.
profile_positions.title: Owner (writer, anthropological researcher, musician)

profile_positions.description:
Pluq is a platform that allows you to compose any kind of music based on samples provided by us. Through (monthly) challenges we encourage you to create, share and vote for your favorite songs. 

I'm responsible for building and maintaining the platform’s blog and music technology database as editor-in-chief, but also for coming up and implementing pluq's marketing and communication.

Currently on hiatus
profile_positions.title: Chief Storytelling Officer

profile_positions.description:
We film and share stories of people who do what genuinely makes them happy. With passion and love for their trade. Because that’s how they create value. In their work and for the people affected by it.

And we believe inspiration can be a driving force of change. For people to take that step and start doing what they love.

I support the team in their storytelling activities by processing the interview material of the people that have been filmed. This includes transcription, preselection, but also translating content. Besides this I'm also responsible for maintaining communication with our contacts and our social media channels.
profile_positions.title: Copywriter, translator and transcriber

profile_positions.description: Wakkere Honden is an all-volunteer radio show, every wednesday through saturday from 0:00 - 02:00 on RTV Rijnmond. I'm currently collaborating on two of its shows, 'Jaccuzi' and 'Totalitariërs', and in the past also on 'Radio Aktief'. At Radio Aktief we're taking a closer look into Rotterdam's nightlife. Totalitariërs is a mix of political satire, popular culture, dark electronic music and radical chic. Jaccuzi is, as the name might suggest, more sultry in its themes, combining the sexiest songs with 			discussions on the decadent lifestyles of some of the high and mighty.
profile_positions.title: Wakkere Honden (Storyteller: Interviewer and Guest Speaker)

profile_positions.description:
The Dutch online art publication ONGEkUNSTELD was originally founded by Eva van Sloten and Anne Bergshoeff, the platform seeks to provide readers with an unpretentious view of what art might be.

My tasks at ONGEkUNSTELD are writing content, editing submitted articles, and maintaining ONGEkUNSTELD's social media channels.
profile_positions.title: Editor/Columnist

profile_positions.description: As chief storytelling officer I'm responsible for BroodNodig's communication activities. BroodNodig is a foundation that sees bread waste as a source of sustainable products. Besides this I'm also carrying out the market research needed for BroodNodig's product development, guide the research projects of our interns, and carry out editorial tasks for the website.
profile_positions.title: Chief storytelling officer (CSO)

profile_positions.description: In support of MKB Brandstof's radio campaign I was assigned to help out at their customer support. I mainly did inbound customer service, but also processed already existing clients.
profile_positions.title: Customer Service Representative

profile_positions.description:
In order to help others in their storytelling, I've been working as a writing guide and editor after I finished studying. At first I only worked with students who were working on their thesis projects. Later on my clientele also included students who needed help writing normal essays and preparing presentation.

I primarily work as an editor, second reading the students' work. However, I also meet up with students to work on the fundamentals of their projects such as structure and content.

Since July 2013 I continued this work as part of YURKO.
profile_positions.title: Editor: Thesis Guide, Student Support, Writing Guide

profile_positions.description:
WOVOX offers people a peek inside companies through photos, videos, reviews and visual job openings. This way it's easier and more effectively for people to get to know companies. This creates trust, which results not only in the right people showing up at those companies, but also makes them stay longer. WOVOX' goal is to create this match more effectively, and to make the journey towards it nicer and more personal.

My own role within WOVOX is that of storyteller (Content marketing), this means that I work both as author and interviewer. I write articles for WOVOX' media partners, such as The Next Web and NUzakelijk. I'm also responsible for bringing in new partners through whom we can spread our material.
Other activities include project management, working as an editor for other people's texts and carrying out communications with clients, leads and partners.
profile_positions.title: CSO (Chief Storytelling Officer) - Content Marketing: Interviewer, Author, Communications, Editor

volunteer_experiences.description: Alongside many other volunteers I helped in the final stages of building 'Park Pompenburg' in Rotterdam, which is part of the Luchtsingel project. For more info, please check the Luchtsingel website: http://www.luchtsingel.org/en/visit/park-pompenburg/
